key_risks: Regulatory and compliance risks due to evolving data privacy, AML, and financial compliance requirements
Cybersecurity vulnerabilities highlighted by a recent data breach
Dependence on a small number of high-profile clients
Intense competition from established players and emerging fintech disruptors
Operational risks related to system outages and scalability challenges
controversies: Security breach in September 2023 compromising approximately 204 bytes of data
Reduced transaction volumes from key clients impacting total processed volume
environmental_issues: Need for transparency and measurable progress in carbon reduction initiatives
social_issues: Ongoing vulnerabilities in fraud prevention and data security despite recent breaches
governance_issues: Navigating complex regulatory environments and maintaining compliance

sources.title: PCI DSS requirements v4.0: An update from an Adyen Data Security ...
sources.snippet: PCI DSS is a set of technical and operational requirements intended to protect account data, combat fraud, and reduce the chances of a data breach. Launched in 2006, PCI DSS was developed by the PCI Security Standards Council (PCI SSC), an independent body made up of MasterCard, Visa, American Express, JCB, and Discover.

sources.title: Risk management | Adyen Docs
sources.snippet: Get started. Before you begin setting up risk, determine which risk engine you are using. To find out which risk engine you use: Log in to your Customer Area with your company account.; Go to Revenue & risk > Risk profiles.; Select a risk profile > Risk rules and check which tabs you see: If you see the tabs Allow, Block and Review (premium only), go to configure risk.
sources.query_context: ADYEN NV ADYEN NV client dependency risks

sources.title: Create and assign risk profiles | Adyen Docs
sources.snippet: Create a risk profile. Log in to your Customer Area with your company account.; Go to Revenue & risk > Risk profiles.; Select Create new profile.; In the Profile name, type a name for the new risk profile.Then, from the Based on profile drop down, select the risk profile that will be the template for your new profile.; Select Create.Refresh the page to see your changes.

sources.title: Adyen Risk Management
sources.snippet: In recent years we've seen giant leaps forward in fraud prevention (and abbreviations). We're sure you're sick of hearing about the holy trinity of risk management: 3D Secure(3DS), Strong Customer Authentication(SCA), and the Payment Services Directive 2 (PSD2). sources.title: Risk management | Adyen Docs
sources.snippet: To turn on the Adyen risk management system for point of sale: Log into your Customer Area and select an account: Company account: to enable risk checks by default for all point-of-sale transactions on all your merchant accounts. Merchant account: to enable risk checks only for point-of-sale transactions on a specific merchant account.
